text:
Been lurking here for a while, thought I'd share my over a year experience with Ozempic. I'm a 32F/M and started at 255 lbs.

I have to say the benefits are real - A1C improvement is incredible - 9.2 down to 5.9 and I feel so much better overall. I'm finally not thinking about food 24/7.

Would love to hear others' experiences! Sorry for the wall of text!

Okay so, about 3 weeks into Ozempic and here's what's happening: My doctor prescribed this for weight loss.

What's working really well: the constant cravings have disappeared.

Just wanted to share - hang in there everyone! Sorry for the wall of text!

Been on this medication for 8 months now treating Weight Loss. Background: 55F, weight issues diagnosis about 3 years ago.

The benefits don't outweigh the challenges for me personally.

Okay so, almost a year into Ozempic and here's what's happening: My doctor prescribed this for insulin resistance.

The good news: I'm down 15 pounds and my clothes are fitting so much better and honestly it feels surreal.

Still figuring this out but staying hopeful.

After half a year using Ozempic for Type 2 Diabetes, here's my honest review: I'm 46 years old and have struggled with obesity for years.

Benefits I've experienced: the food noise in my head is completely gone

Challenges I've faced: hair loss is starting to worry me honestly. This is my biggest complaint.

I'm managing by eating smaller portions and staying hydrated.

Would I recommend it? Yes, but with reservations.

Quick check-in after 4 months on this medication:

The results have been amazing - I'm finally not thinking about food 24/7.

But it hasn't been all smooth sailing. had some vomiting issues, especially if I eat too much especially in the mornings. nausea hits me hard, particularly in the mornings it seems to come in waves.

For me, these results are absolutely worth the discomfort. I'm staying committed to seeing this through.

Hope this helps someone considering it.

Just wanted to give an update after 6 weeks on Ozempic.

I have to say the benefits are real - feeling more energetic than I have in years.

However, there are definitely some challenges. tiredness is a real issue I'm working through throughout the day.

I'm handling it by prescription anti-nausea meds. The trade-off is worth it when I see the progress.

Still figuring this out but staying hopeful. This sub has been so helpful for me.

Been lurking here for a while, thought I'd share my 18 months experience with Ozempic.

The downsides I'm experiencing: dealing with persistent nausea - some days are worse than others throughout the day.

I'm handling it by adjusting my meal timing. The benefits far outweigh the side effects in my opinion.

Anyone else experiencing similar things?

Real talk - 4 months on Ozempic has been...

However, there are definitely some challenges. struggling with constipation more than I expected throughout the day. digestive issues including some diarrhea episodes mostly during the first week of each new dose.

Just wanted to share - hang in there everyone!

I started my Ozempic journey 8 months ago and honestly,

I have to say the benefits are real - the fatigue I used to feel is mostly gone.

The side effects though... they're real. the nausea is real and it can be debilitating at times particularly in the first 2-3 days after injection.

Using ginger tea and small frequent meals to cope and it's working okay. The trade-off is worth it when I see the progress. I keep reminding myself why I started this.

Would love to hear others' experiences!

I've been taking Ozempic for 7 months for Weight Loss.

On the plus side: lost 22 lbs so far and people are starting to notice. My clothes fit better and I have more energy

However, the side effects have been significant. headaches have been more frequent since starting. Some days are worse than others.

I'm managing by anti-nausea medication from my doctor.

Overall, I would recommend discussing this with your doctor.

Been on this medication for 3 months now treating Weight Loss. As a 55-year-old with insulin resistance, this has been life-changing.

However, the side effects have been significant. constipation has been an ongoing issue I'm dealing with. Some days are worse than others the fatigue during the first week was intense. This is my biggest complaint.

Consult carefully with your doctor about potential side effects.

Started Ozempic 4 months ago prescribed by my doctor for Type 2 Diabetes. Background: 46F, obesity diagnosis about 3 years ago.

Benefits I've experienced: lost 18 lbs so far and people are starting to notice. This is the most I've ever lost on any medication

Side effects I'm dealing with: the nausea is real and it can be debilitating at times. It's been quite challenging.

Honestly, it's a small price to pay for these results.

Despite the side effects, this has been worth it for me.

Been on this medication for 6 weeks now treating Weight Loss.

However, the side effects have been significant. the fatigue during the first week was intense. Some days are worse than others.

Consult carefully with your doctor about potential side effects.

After 3 months using Ozempic for Weight Loss, here's my honest review:

The negative aspects: the constipation is uncomfortable and persistent. This has been difficult to manage.

The side effects are too much for me to continue long-term.
